snippet: Organizers of food cooperatives talk of unifying communities and bringing healthy options to low-income neighborhoods, but cultural barriers and resentment can make that message a hard sell.
abstract: Organizers of food cooperatives talk of unifying communities and bringing healthy options to low-income neighborhoods, but cultural barriers and resentment can make that message a hard sell; to attract its Hispanic neighbors, a co-op in Bushwick, Brooklyn, is translating its signs into Spanish; it offers a low-cost membership for those on public assistance and holds outreach events with local groups.
lead_paragraph: Organizers of food cooperatives talk of unifying communities and bringing healthy options to low-income neighborhoods, but cultural barriers and resentment can make that message a hard sell.

headline.main: Food Co-ops in Gentrifying Areas Find They Aren’t to Every Taste
headline.print_headline: Co-ops Find They Aren’t to Every Taste
